title: Relapsing Polychondritis: Clinical Overview
short_description: Clinical document describing the demographic characteristics and age of onset for relapsing polychondritis.
long_description: This clinical document provides essential demographic and epidemiological information about relapsing polychondritis, a rare inflammatory condition affecting cartilaginous structures. The document outlines that the condition shows no gender preference, affecting males and females equally, and typically manifests in middle-aged adults between the fourth and sixth decades of life. This information is fundamental for healthcare providers in understanding the patient population most commonly affected by this autoimmune disorder.
